title: If the cost price of 10 articles is equal to the selling price of 9 articles, what is the gain or loss percent? - Quora

response.answer_text: Answer: Gain percent = 11.111 % Solution: Let ‘x’ be the cost price of 10 articles. Cost price of unit article = x/10 Selling price of 9 articles = x Selling price of unit article = x/9 Gain per unit article = (x/9) - (x/10) = x(1/9–1/10) = x (1/90) = x/90 Percentage of gain (%) = (Gain/Cost)100 = ((x/90)/(x/10))100 = (x/90)(10/x)100 = (10/90)100 = 100/9 = 11.111

Once again a ten second problem . Let C , P , and S be the cost price , the profit , and the selling price of one piece of that article respectively. So 10C=9c+9P . Or C=9P , Or P=C/9 . So the %age profit =100 x (C/9)/C=100/9=11.11%//
